p:
Our findings are in agreement with McGaw et al
55 . who reported that in the evaluation of antibacterial activities of hexane, ethanol and aqueous leaf extracts of H. arborescens against Bacillus subtilis, S. aureus, E. coli, and K. pneumoniae, only ethanol extract exhibited antibacterial activities. These findings correlate with observation made by Wigmore et al
56 . that aqueous extracts of plants showed less antibacterial activity when compared with other solvents. Furthermore, in agreement with our findings, the aqueous extract was inactive against all Gram-positive bacteria used. However, contrarily, the aqueous extract was active against S. aureus and S. epidermidis
3 .
